title: Renault in Formula One
summary: The French automotive manufacturer Renault has been associated with Formula One as both team owner and engine manufacturer for various periods since 1977.[1] In 1977, the company entered Formula One as a constructor, introducing the turbo engine to Formula One with its EF1 engine. In 1983, Renault began supplying engines to other teams.[2] Although the Renault team had won races, it withdrew at the end of 1985.[3] Renault engines continued to be raced until 1986.
